body:
@zenglinxi0615 Thanks for the fix! 
Change looks good to me. (CI result https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-zeppelin/builds/78241201)

Thanks for usage. tested and working well.
LGTM!

#224 was closed, and I'm not sure why.

You can find most of the differences in this PR thread, main ones being:
- Copy paste of message allowed (no more close notification when clicked)
- Closing button on the notification

This PR only brings the Notification Service, so that we separate adding the notifications in the zeppelin code from adding the Notification Service.

On top of what @Madhuka said, you will also have to inject the service in your controller, for example:

```
angular.module('zeppelinWebApp')
  .controller('ParagraphCtrl', function($scope, $rootScope, $route, $window, $element, $routeParams, $location, $timeout, $compile, websocketMsgSrv, ngToast) {
```

@Leemoonsoo 
can you merge these patchs?
Merging if there're no more discussions.
Ready to merge. Please review the changes
merging if there is no more discussions
merging if there're no more discussions
LGTM, i'm merging it if there're no more discussions
+1 on 3.2.3 - I think that version is required to build Spark
@corneadoug now that #56 has finally been merged we're still experiencing the data order issue fixed by this PR. Is there a chance this will be merged into master?

@lucarosellini #56 scope was shortened because of all the changes it was bringing to the project.
So in the end, there was no clear separation of paragraph.js or modification of the pivot, which means the issue still exist.

So far, my feeling was that it was just moving the ordering problem to other cases. (post pivot)
I can run a few test on this PR again, to double check.
Merging it quickly, as it provides hot fix for ZEPPELIN-276, that breaks zeppelin working from guided build command "mvn clean package", in master branch.
I have addressed most review comments. Does travis run unit tests ?

Yes it does (and looks like [CI is failing](https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-zeppelin/builds/78497074)), but somehow I do not see Travis feedback for this PR any more.
Can you try closing and re-opening the PR? This should trigger CI again

Hmm. Travis failed because it lost connection to maven central.

INFO: Retrying request to {s}->https://repo.maven.apache.org:443
[WARNING] Could not transfer metadata org.scala-tools:maven-scala-plugin/maven-metadata.xml from/to central (https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2): Connection reset
Looks good to me!

As far as I know, the only requirment on min maven version comes from eirslett/frontend-maven-plugin#229 and is enforced here [frontend-maven-plugin/pom.xml#L15](https://github.com/eirslett/frontend-maven-plugin/blob/master/frontend-maven-plugin/pom.xml#L15)
Thanks for merging.
Looks great to me :shipit:

You should change the title to ">= 3.1.0" rather than "< 3.1.0". Btw, Spark now requires Maven 3.3.3 as of the soon-to-be-released version 1.5.0. (See http://people.apache.org/~pwendell/spark-releases/latest/building-spark.html)

@ejono thank you!

The reason for current restriction on mvn version in Zeppelin is discussed in #265. Spark project must have it's own reasons, I suppose.

Thank you for great contribution!
Can you please also provide the documentation for new interpreter (needs to be in a separate PR to gh-pages branch)?

I.e right now it looks like only a limited subset of commands is supported, so it's a good idea mention things like that.

We keep track of list of interpreters here https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/blob/gh-pages/docs/index.md and here https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/tree/gh-pages/docs/interpreter a new 'page' can be added.

This is awesome improvement, thank you @Leemoonsoo
Looks great to me.

@corneadoug,  have you had chance on writing an unit test(s) for this PR? 
If you have not time and there are no other objections may i suggest to have this improvement merged? It is been hanging around for some time now and there few other tickets depending on it as well.
@tzolov I started doing it, if possible give me a day to finish it up
@corneadoug, glad to hear you are working on this. Take your time. Your help is highly appreciated and will help me/us learn how to write such tests!
looks good
I'll start a new PR.
Please review https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/pull/278
Unit tests passed.
Most probably you also want to update `conf/zeppelin-site.xml.template` property `zeppelin.interpreters` with name of the new interpreter class
To trigger CI
LGTM

From CI, seems like Selenium tests hang

```
No output has been received in the last 10 minutes, this potentially indicates a stalled build or something wrong with the build itself.

The build has been terminated
```

Triggering again

Something strange going on with TravisCI:

```
WARNING: We were unable to find a .travis.yml file. This may not be what you
  want. Build will be run with default settings.
Using worker: worker-linux-docker-c59fef2c.prod.travis-ci.org:travis-linux-3
Could not find .travis.yml, using standard configuration.
```

Triggering again
Same again, it complains on `.travis.yml`, which is clearly present in the codebase... Going to wait and then trigger once again
I have pushed more commits, that handles pyspark. Please review them, too.
could this go to a config?
Ready to merge. #81 can be merged right after
Ready to merge, after #280

This oneliner is ready for reviewing. It works excellent with the interpreters i've been using and really improves the UX perception.
But I wonder if there are interpreters (python?) for which the (tab) key is preferred to act as tab rather an auto-completion shortcut?
LGTM
LGTM
Looks good to me!
LGTM
@Leemoonsoo how does z.load work with spark-submit? Seems those dependency jars should be added automatically to spark-submit's --jars argument.
Looks good to me

CI is _very unstable_ - same command over the same branch passes on my machine

```
mvn package -Pspark-1.1 -Phadoop-2.3 -B -pl 'zeppelin-interpreter,zeppelin-zengine,zeppelin-server' '-Dtest=org.apache.zeppelin.rest.*Test' -DfailIfNoTests=false
....
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Reactor Summary:
[INFO]
[INFO] Zeppelin: Interpreter .............................. SUCCESS [ 11.548 s]
[INFO] Zeppelin: Zengine .................................. SUCCESS [  6.093 s]
[INFO] Zeppelin: Server ................................... SUCCESS [01:26 min]
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
```

Build for the same revistion of the same branch, under [my Travis-CI profile](https://travis-ci.org/bzz/incubator-zeppelin/builds/78839035) fails in totaly different way, on `zeppelin-web` compile (!!!)

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal com.github.eirslett:frontend-maven-plugin:0.0.23:grunt (grunt build) on project zeppelin-web: Failed to run task: 'grunt --no-color' failed. (error code 3) -> [Help 1]
```
Giving it one more chance...

On CI `mvn package -Pspark-1.1 -Phadoop-2.3 -Ppyspark -B -pl 'zeppelin-interpreter,spark-dependencies,spark`

```
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
    at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:57)
         ....
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: scala/tools/nsc/settings/AbsSettings$AbsSetting
    at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
    at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:274)
    at org.apache.zeppelin.interpreter.InterpreterFactory.init(InterpreterFactory.java:124)
    at org.apache.zeppelin.interpreter.InterpreterFactory.<init>(InterpreterFactory.java:103)
    at org.apache.zeppelin.interpreter.InterpreterFactory.<init>(InterpreterFactory.java:85)
    at org.apache.zeppelin.server.ZeppelinServer.<init>(ZeppelinServer.java:310)
    ... 28 more
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: scala.tools.nsc.settings.AbsSettings$AbsSetting
    at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:366)
    at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:355)
    at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
```

on local machine build passes.

Can somebody please confirm that?
@randerzander  dependency jars downloaded from z.load() is being loaded after SparkContext is created by calling sc.addJar(). So i think it'll not be affected by this change.
LGTM
LGTM

Thanks. I've tested this branch and the feature itself working well.
However, depends on language, TAB is not ideal for some language like python or scala. (for them '.' is more appropriate i think).

I think code editor need to get some informations from interpreter. Not only keyboard shortcuts for completion, but also like syntax highlight scheme and many more.
looks good!

Thanks, Overall looks good.
It's a good starting point
Fixed and ready for review.
@tzolov let's rebase once #250 is merged, so that I can do a PR without conflicts

+1 @Leemoonsoo  https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-214
I think we should be good with this PR and track the bigger work on interpreter environment settings in a JIRA.

Could you elaborate on what this does?

```
hbase.irb.load: (Testing only) Default is true. Whether to load irb in the interpreter.
```

+1 to get  syntax highlight for editor.
Since we can add new interpreters to zeppelin.  It is important add plug auto-completion (js-hint) for editors. 

Architecture of the auto-completion of editor need to extend-able as we have multiple interpreters.
@corneadoug it is done. just rebased (after ZEPPELIN-228) and pushed.

All:  This should now be functional.  Tests pass (there may still be some spurious errors on Travis, but I'm not seeing them).  And it should run out-of-box.  People should definitely start looking at it.
Good catch, thank you for fixing it.
Merging, if there're no more discussions.

`mvn package -Pspark-1.1 -Phadoop-2.3 -B -pl 'zeppelin-interpreter,zeppelin-zengine,zeppelin-server' '-Dtest=org.apache.zeppelin.rest.*Test' -DfailIfNoTests=false` passes on my machine well.

@Leemoonsoo can you please give it a try and let me know if it works for you too?
Are you sure that things like 754c55e and  4f3c840  a849b4b d1d32b1 are intended to be part of this PR\branch\contribution?

This wasn't my intention,  I am only changing 2 files but this was probebly due to rebase on master. I will try and see how to fix it.
Sorry.

No problem, enthusiastic :+1: for tests!

Yes, interactive rebasing might be a good idea or it might be even simpler to re-create this PR from the latest master, cherry-picking the particular commits.
Unneeded commits in the PR, closing and re-creating from master.

Just closed the PR and opened a new one PR #286.
Hope it will pass CI and ready for merge.
Eran

Just spent a lot of time on this.
I think we will have to create an issue, and do the tests later.
With Current version of ui-ace that we use, we can't test it because of a bug (https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-ace/issues/73)
We would need to Bump to newer version (0.2.x), but those versions have breaking changes.
I pretty much figured out what we need to change, but can't guarantee that everything would be working (it would take lot of time to manually test + write tests). which would delay more this PR.
So the best would be to do the test later.

Thanks for the update @corneadoug. I've faced the ace upgrade issue while preparing the (ZEPPELIN-216).  When i tried to upgrade ace to 1.2.0 the existing ui-ace version complained. I've managed to increase ui-ace but had to force some dependency resolutions and was not confident it will not cause side effects. So i upgraded ace to safest ace 1.1.9 version instead. But if you manage to upgrade ui-ace (very outdated it seems) it will allow us upgrade ace-build as well. 
Also i would still love to learn how to write angular controller unit tests. 

@Leemoonsoo , @felixcheung it seems that this PR (e.g. ZEPPELIN-219) is ready to merge.
The tests will come after the ui-ace upgrade.

@tzolov : You can find few test in PR #262, 
+1 for the merge (I too can support on writing test)
Looks good to me!
Looks good to me!

@bzz 

I tried `mvn package -Pspark-1.1 -Phadoop-2.3 -B -DskipTests`

And then `mvn package -Pspark-1.1 -Phadoop-2.3 -B -pl 'zeppelin-interpreter,zeppelin-zengine,zeppelin-server' '-Dtest=org.apache.zeppelin.rest.*Test' -DfailIfNoTests=false`.

It fails with the same exception, `Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: scala/tools/nsc/settings/AbsSettings$AbsSetting`
Thanks. LGTM!

At the moment, there're no mechanism that sends these type of configuration to the front-end side.
I think there should be some common way to get configurations from front-end side, so not only this but also other necessary parameters can be configured.

I think this PR can be merged, config can be handled as a future work.
looks good
@felixcheung I have addressed your comments. Please take a look
